Body: I can very well see in the Settings > Applications > Manage Applications screen that internal memory (ummm I think thats the ROM) of my phone is almost filled up. Although I can see in Running Services screen that more than 150MB of RAM is still free.My device started giving this behavior.some apps crash automaticallySome apps does not start at all. When I click on them they simply simply flash the screenSome games after loading and showing the menu and main screen animation, when I click on Play or Start new game, it does not do anythingNow I stuck with this ROM fill up. I have moved all apps that I can move to SD card through AppMgr Pro III (App 2 SD). But still many apps have some footprints in internal memory (or ROM??) since I can still see them in the Manage Applications screen. Why is it so? What could be the other way out, apart from uninstalling unused apps.
Title: Some apps closing, crashing, some not starting, flashing

history.Text: I can very well see in Settings > Applications > Manage Applications screen that internal memory (ummm I think thats the ROM) of my phone is almost filled up. Although I can see in Running Services screen that more than 150MB of RAM is still free.My device started giving this behavior. - some devices crash automatically - Some apps does not start at all. When I click on them they simply simply flash the screen - Some games after loading and showing the menu and main screen animation, when I click on Play or Start new game, it does not do anythingNow I stuck with this ROM fill up. I have moved all apps that I can move to SD card through [AppMgr Pro III (App 2 SD)][1]. But still many apps have some footprints in internal memory (or ROM??) since I can still see them in manage Applications screen. Why is it so? What could be the other way out, apart from uninstalling unused apps.  [1]: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.a0soft.gphone.app2sd.pro&hl=en

history.Text: I can very well see in the *Settings > Applications > Manage Applications* screen that internal memory (ummm I think thats the ROM) of my phone is almost filled up. Although I can see in Running Services screen that more than 150MB of RAM is still free.My device started giving this behavior. - some apps crash automatically - Some apps does not start at all. When I click on them they simply simply flash the screen - Some games after loading and showing the menu and main screen animation, when I click on Play or Start new game, it does not do anythingNow I stuck with this ROM fill up. I have moved all apps that I can move to SD card through [AppMgr Pro III (App 2 SD)][1]. But still many apps have some footprints in internal memory (or ROM??) since I can still see them in the *Manage Applications* screen. Why is it so? What could be the other way out, apart from uninstalling unused apps.  [1]: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.a0soft.gphone.app2sd.pro&hl=en
